body.name: Western Digital 10TB WD Purple Pro Surveillance Internal Hard Drive HDD - SATA 6 Gb/s, 256 MB Cache, 3.5" - WD101PURP
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by NUTech.
features: Engineered with advanced capabilities needed for high-end smart video solutions
High performance, reliability and workload capability for advanced AI-enabled recorders, video analytics appliances, deep-learning servers and cloud-based storage
Supports up to 550 TB/yr workload rate**.
Designed with tarnish-resistant components for harsh environments, and with additional robustness for multi-bay enclosures
body.description: WD Purple Pro drives are designed for new generations of high-end AI-enabled recorders, video analytics appliances, deep-learning servers and cloud solutions that can benefit from high-capacity storage with high performance and additional workload capability. WD Purple Pro drives feature AllFrame AI technology, which helps reduce frame loss, improve overall video playback, and not only enables recording of multiple streams per camera but also supports up to 32 AI streams per drive for deep learning analytics within the system. WD Purple Pro drives also feature enterprise-class performance, data integrity and drive reliability, especially in larger-scale systems and enclosures where operational vibration is present.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Advanced Storage for Smart Video Solutions WD Purple Pro drives are designed for new generations of high-end AI-enabled recorders, video analytics appliances, deep-learning servers, and cloud solutions that can benefit from high-capacity storage with high performance and additional workload capability.

Empower your smart video solution WD Purple Pro is designed for high performance, durability, and workload capability for always-on AI smart video recorders, appliances and servers. AllFrame AI technology AllFrame AI technology reduces frame loss, improves overall video playback, and supports up to 32 AI streams for deep learning analytics. Multiple cameras, multiple streams WD Purple Pro drives are optimized to support many of the latest smart cameras that transmit multiple streams. Advanced workload capability WD Purple Pro drives feature a workload rating up to 550TB/year** to support the heavy video data capture and analysis found in AI-enabled recorders.
Uncompromising Surveillance Storage WD Purple drives are designed for surveillance to help withstand the elevated heat fluctuations and equipment vibrations within NVR environments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Use these beasts for my personal 3D animation mini-render farm
reviews.reviewText: These robust, high speed, "24-hour video recording" 18TB HD's make for a terrific solution for churning out monster-sized file renderings from 3D software (Maya, Houdini, etc). The things are absolute beasts, and their resilience and beefiness is exactly why I use them for my "small" personal render farm (one 2-disc 36TB RAID-0 for smaller renders, and a 5-disc 90TB RAID-0 tower for bigger renders) in my home office. Sure, I could have gone for the "Black" version that a lot of gamers prefer (if they are using SATA instead of SSD), but these drives are larger capacity with the same speed, and built to handle even more stress.Should last me several years, no problem, but I will collect a couple more to keep on hand in case (or when) any of the originals fail...Eventually, yes, I'll likely go all-SSD in the future, but not until they are at the same price-point, with the same-or-greater TB size, and equally "indestructible".Brilliant slabs of hardware.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Massive HD Space for Surveillance Server
reviews.reviewText: Utilizing the WD Purple drives in my NAS Blueiris Server, which diligently records footage from 12 cameras around the clock, has been an astute decision. While configuring my storage solution, I weighed several considerations, and one that prominently featured was my acceptance of potential catastrophic drive loss on that data. This decision led me to opt out of running backups or implementing a RAID configuration. However, I still yearned for a level of reliability that would minimize the need for frequent server intervention. That's where WD Purple drives have truly excelled.These drives have proven to be the perfect fit for my needs. Their specialized design for surveillance systems and continuous recording provides a reassuring level of durability and performance. I appreciate that they can withstand the constant write cycles, ensuring longevity even under demanding 24/7 operation. While I've accepted the possibility of drive failure, the reliability of WD Purple drives has given me peace of mind that I won't have to tinker with the server frequently. They've struck that sweet spot between reliability and performance, making them the ideal choice for those who prioritize continuous surveillance recording without the need for complex redundancy systems. WD Purple drives have been the dependable backbone of my surveillance setup, and I couldn't be happier with their performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am using this drive to backup home surveillance videos and have had no issues with it. Fairly reliable and plenty of storage. Very happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Recommended for those who want to store important documents or videos for a long time.
reviews.reviewText: It's already been two years since I purchased this product, but the reason I'm writing a review now is because this product is a really good hard drive. Due to the nature of my job, I use hard disks a lot. I always use a hard disk when installing a camera, but before using this product, I always had problems with the hard disk and had to go to service. Since finding, purchasing, and using this product, the number of times I have to go to service for a hard disk problem has become very rare. Due to the nature of the camera hard drive running 24 hours a day, I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great for expanded storage for my SureVision NVR
reviews.reviewText: I received the 12TB WD purple internal hard drive, installed it, powered-up my SureVision NVR. It automatically formatted and initialized upon powering-up, went smoothly with no problems. I am using this with 16 4K (8 megapixel) IP cameras, so this internal hard drive was definitely needed. It is working great so far which is worth a 5-star rating; however, I am giving it a 4-star overall rating because the "What's in the box" says it includes "Mounting Screws, Quick Install Guide." These 2 items were missing in the box. Even though the box was securely sealed, only the hard drive was enclosed in the sealed box. Also, be aware that the SATA data cable and power cable are not included with this item. You will need to already have your own, or purchase them separately. This hard drive is running smoothly and quietly in my NVR 24/7.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased drive for an application that constantly writes content. Read many reviews for both Western Digital purple and Seagate Skyhawk. The reviews were pretty even and Western Digital had a larger 512gb buffer and slightly cheaper. Please note, we purchased the 14tb drive and have 13tb usable after formatting. Please keep this in mind for space planning.Performance has been great. Watching disk queue length and not seeing bottlenecks at the disk level.Longevity is unknown right now. If we experience a premature failure or significant change in drive use experience we will update our review.Right now we are very happy with the drive and have plans to buy more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Did not work
reviews.reviewText: The drive buzzed a few times then silence, would not start. Attempted in two devices. This was Amazon "used good". The drive looked fine, just a couple small (3/16") scratches. Too bad it didn't work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Performing Drive for Surveillance System
reviews.reviewText: I use this drives with Synology's Surveillance Station and it has performed great with no issues. These WD Purple drives give me peace of mind knowing that these drives are built to withstand continuous writes 24x7 by nature of surveillance systems.
Me encanto ya que el precio es accesible
O HD é rápido para salvar as informações, muito bom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon had the best price by far on these units.
reviews.reviewText: These drives are designed specifically for video surveillance NVR's. They are made for continuous write and rewrite, and are the absolute best bet for any NVR. Storage capacity is massive at 10 terabytes, so I've got four of them which gives me enough capacity to run all 27 cameras I'm continuous recording for over a month, if I choose to set it up that way.
Bought 8TB Surveillance for my CCTV and installed on 1-1-2024. On16-1-2024, product is not detected by DVR. Tried to connect to PC too, yet not detected

reviews.reviewTitle: läuft in einem Hikvision NVR DS-7732NXI-K4 ohne Probleme :)
reviews.reviewText: .) läuft in einem Hikvision NVR DS-7732NXI-K4 ohne Probleme :).) es wird die volle Kapazität von 11.176 GB erkannt, obwohl die Disk bei Hikvision nicht als "recommended" geführt wird.) ist sehr leise und kaum zu hören, sollte aber trotzdem entkoppelt werden, da sonst das Gehäuse vom NVR die Schwingungen der Platte hörbar überträgt.) die Platten Temperatur liegt bei einer Umgebungstemperatur von 20° bei 34° ohne Last , also überschaubar, auch wenn auf der Disk mal intensiv geschrieben werden sollte
